translation.en: ♪ Look away, look away ♪
♪ Look away, look away ♪
♪ This show will wreck your evening Your whole life and your day ♪
translation.ko: 이 쇼는 당신의 낮과 밤 그리고 일상을 파괴하리니

translation.en: ♪ Every single episode Is nothing but dismay ♪
translation.ko: 에피소드를 모두 알게 될수록 경악하게 될 뿐

translation.en: ♪ So look away Look away, look away ♪
♪ Three children lose their home And go to live with someone awful ♪
translation.ko: 세 아이가 집을 잃고 끔찍한 인간과 함께 사네

translation.en: ♪ He tries to steal their fortune With a plot that's not quite lawful ♪
translation.ko: 놈은 온갖 수법을 동원해 아이들의 재산을 뺏으려 하지

translation.en: ♪ It's hard to fathom how the orphans Managed to live through it ♪
♪ But how a decent person like yourself Would even want to view it ♪
translation.ko: 당신처럼 고결한 인간이 이걸 보고 싶기나 할까?

translation.en: ♪ Just look away, look away ♪
translation.ko: 그냥 시선을 돌려라 눈길을 주지 마라

translation.en: ♪ There's nothing but horror And inconvenience on the way ♪
♪ Ask any stable person "Should I watch?" And they will say ♪
translation.ko: 멀쩡한 사람에게 이걸 봐도 될지 물으면 이렇게 말하리라

translation.en: ♪ Look away, look away, look away ♪
♪ Look away, look away ♪
♪ Look away, look away ♪
translation.ko: "레모니 스니켓 소설 원작" 시선을 돌려라, 저 멀리

translation.en: ♪ Look away, look away ♪
If you are interested in stories with happy endings,
then you would be better off somewhere else.
In this story, not only is there no happy ending,
translation.ko: 이 이야기에는 행복한 결말과 행복한 시작은 물론이고

translation.en: there is no happy beginning, and very few happy things in the middle.
translation.ko: 이 이야기에는 행복한 결말과 행복한 시작은 물론이고 중간에도 행복한 일이 거의 없습니다

translation.en: My name is Lemony Snicket.
It is my solemn duty to bring to light the sorry history
of the Baudelaire children as it happened so many years ago.
translation.ko: 애석한 역사를 폭로하는 게 제 막중한 임무입니다

translation.en: But you in the audience have no such obligation,
translation.ko: 하지만 객석의 여러분은 그런 의무가 없으므로

translation.en: and I would advise all our viewers to turn away immediately
and watch something more pleasant instead.
translation.ko: 더 즐거운 영상을 감상하시길 조언하는 바입니다

translation.en: This story will be dreadful, melancholy and calamitous,
translation.ko: 이 이야기는 끔찍하고 음침하며 비참할 겁니다

translation.en: a word which here means "dreadful and melancholy."
That is because not very many happy things happened
translation.ko: 이는 보들레어 남매의 삶에 행복한 일이

translation.en: in the lives of the Baudelaires.
Violet, Klaus and Sunny were intelligent children.
Charming and resourceful, they had pleasant facial features,
translation.ko: 매력적이고 재치 있으며 호감 가는 이목구비를 지녔지만

translation.en: but they were extremely unlucky.
Most everything that happened to them was rife
translation.ko: 그들의 삶에 일어난 거의 모든 일은

translation.en: with misfortune, misery and despair.
-I'm sorry to tell you this... -[siren wailing]
...but that's how the story goes.
translation.ko: 그러나 이 이야기에는 그런 내용만 있죠

translation.en: Briny Beach, please.
The Baudelaire family lived in an enormous mansion
translation.ko: 보들레어 가족은 더럽고 혼잡한 도심의 거대한 저택에 살았는데

translation.en: at the heart of a dirty and busy city,
translation.ko: 더럽고 혼잡한 도심의 거대한 저택에 살았는데

translation.en: and one day the parents rather unexpectedly asked their children
to take a rickety trolley alone to the seashore.
translation.ko: 낡아 빠진 트램에 태워 해변으로 보냈습니다

translation.en: I wonder why Mother and Father didn't want to come with us.
Maybe they don't like this rickety trolley.
translation.ko: 이 낡아 빠진 트램이 싫으신가 봐

translation.en: "Rickety" is a word here which means
"unsteady" or "likely to collapse at any moment."
Hey, kids! Aren't you going to the Festive Fun Fair,
with all the jolly rides and games and snacks?
"Festive" means "fun."
We know what "festive" means.
Thank you, but it's a perfect morning to go to the beach.
translation.ko: 감사하지만 해변에 가기 딱 좋은 아침이라서요

translation.en: -It's gray and cloudy. -That's what makes it perfect.
Suit yourself.
When Briny Beach was hot and sunny, the seashore was crowded with tourists
translation.ko: 화창한 날의 브라이니 해변은 관광객으로 북적여

translation.en: and it was impossible to find a good place to lay one's blanket.
On gray and cloudy days, the Baudelaires had the beach more or less to themselves,
translation.ko: 뿌옇고 흐린 날에는 보들레어 남매가 해변을 독차지해서

translation.en: so they could work together on their projects and experiments.
translation.ko: 그들의 연구와 실험을 펼칠 수 있었습니다

translation.en: -Are you ready? -Let's get to work.
Do you think this will be as good as the mailbox?
I think this will be even better than the mailbox.
[Lemony] Violet Baudelaire was the eldest Baudelaire child.
She was 14 years old, right-handed,
had a real knack for inventing and building unusual devices.
translation.ko: 발명과 독특한 장비 제작에 뛰어난 재주가 있었습니다

translation.en: I'm having a problem with the grandfather clock.
Can you show me what the specific issues are?
See? It toasts the bread, but the minute hand falls behind five minutes.
translation.ko: 이것 봐, 빵은 굽는데 분침이 5분 느려

translation.en: It could be a problem with the gears.
[sighs] That'd be disappointing. I made them myself.
[Lemony] When Violet Baudelaire tied her hair up like that,
it was a sure sign that the pulleys, levers and gears of her inventing mind
translation.ko: 마음속에 있는 온갖 부품들이 발명을 위해 전속력으로 작동한다는 신호죠

translation.en: were working at top speed.
Klaus, at what angle are the prevailing currents?
The angle of the prevailing currents...
Klaus Baudelaire was the middle child and only boy.
He was a little older than 12 and wore glasses, which made him look intelligent.
translation.ko: 갓 12살이 됐고 안경을 써서 똑똑해 보였죠

translation.en: Of course, we still need the right projectile.
He was intelligent.
[Klaus] Violet, I'm not sure I understand this passage of Proust.
translation.ko: 누나, 프루스트의 이 구절을 이해 못 하겠어

translation.en: Could you read it to me?
"Happiness is beneficial for the body,
but it is grief that develops the powers of the mind."
It could be the translation.
Maybe it makes more sense in the original French.
translation.ko: 불어 원문은 이해가 더 잘될지도 몰라

translation.en: Sunny, do we have the right projectile?
-[babbles] -[Lemony] Sunny Baudelaire was an infant,
a word which here means "a person of the age
translation.ko: 서니 보들레어는 유아였고 여기서 '유아'란 '주로 이해할 수 없는 옹알이만 하는 나이의 아이'로

translation.en: at which one mostly speaks in a series of unintelligible shrieks,"
translation.ko: '주로 이해할 수 없는 옹알이만 하는 나이의 아이'로

translation.en: so most people had trouble understanding what she was saying.
translation.ko: 대부분 사람은 서니의 말을 이해하지 못했죠

translation.en: [Lemony] What Sunny lacked in communication skills, however,
she made up for with the size and sharpness of her four teeth.
translation.ko: 네 번째 치아의 크기와 날카로움으로 만회했습니다

translation.en: That's perfect, Sunny. Thank you.
Excuse me, Violet, but why are you using your left hand?
I'm curious to see if I can skip the rock as far with my left as I can with my right.
translation.ko: 왼손 물수제비도 오른손만큼 멀리 갈까 궁금해서

translation.en: I don't mean to criticize,
but standard scientific method calls for stable systematics.
translation.ko: 표준 실험 방법은 확실한 계통학을 요구해

translation.en: You should use your standard right-handedness.
That does seem reasonable.
Klaus, what's that thing Einstein said?
"The most beautiful thing we can experience is the mysterious.
translation.ko: '우리가 겪을 수 있는 가장 아름다운 경험은 신비다'

translation.en: It is the source of all true art and science."
And what's that thing James Brown said?
"I got something that makes me want to shout."
"I've got something that tells me what it's all about."
[both] "I'm super bad!"
It worked.
-I never expected otherwise. -[chuckles]
Yes, the invention worked.
This would be a perfect time to leave
and pretend the rest of the story was just as happy and successful.
translation.ko: 나머지 얘기도 행복하고 성공적인 척할 때죠

translation.en: I just wish Mother and Father had seen it.
It's not like them to send us off on our own so unexpectedly.
[Lemony] Certainly, I wish I could go back
and change the history of the Baudelaires at this very moment
rather than the descent into misery, tribulation and...
dire inconvenience which will occur shortly.
translation.ko: 이내 발생할 지독한 불편을 겪지 않도록 말이죠

translation.en: It only seems scary because of all the mist.
It's Mr. Poe.
From the bank? What's he doing here?
-How do you do? -How do you do?
[coughs] Fine, thank you.
It's a nice day.
It is a nice day.
I have some very bad news for you children.
translation.ko: 너희에게 전할 몹시 나쁜 소식이 있단다

translation.en: Your parents have perished in a terrible fire.
They perished in a fire that destroyed your entire home.
translation.ko: 집을 통째로 무너뜨릴 만큼 아주 큰 화재로 돌아가셨단다

translation.en: I'm very, very sorry to have to tell you this...
translation.ko: 이런 소식을 전해야 하다니 너무너무 유감이구나

translation.en: my dears.
"Perished" means "killed."
We know what "perished" means.
Hey.
I have spent months of research and years crying myself to sleep,
translation.ko: 저는 몇 달간 조사하고 몇 년간 울다 잠들며

translation.en: trying to discover the precise cause of the Baudelaire fire.
translation.ko: 보들레어 저택 화재의 정확한 원인을 밝히려 했습니다

translation.en: But... all my associates and I have managed to learn
translation.ko: 그러나 제 동료들과 제가 확인한 바에 따르면

translation.en: is that neither the official fire department
nor the volunteer fire department arrived in time to stop the blaze.
translation.ko: 의용 소방대조차도 화재를 진압하러 당도하지 않았고

translation.en: And within moments, the entire Baudelaire mansion
was engulfed in flames.
It is useless for me to describe to you how terrible Violet, Klaus and Sunny felt
in the time that followed.
If you have ever lost somebody very important to you,
translation.ko: 매우 소중한 이를 잃은 적 있다면

translation.en: then you already know how it feels.
And if you haven't... you cannot possibly imagine it.
translation.ko: 그런 경험이 없다면 감히 짐작도 못 하실 겁니다

translation.en: I've never been through anything like this myself,
translation.ko: 나는 이런 일을 겪은 적 없지만

translation.en: but I can imagine just how you feel.
I did think you'd want to see what remains of your home,
translation.ko: 너희가 집의 잔해를 확인하려 할 줄 알았다

translation.en: even though it is... [sighs] more or less, um...
It's all gone.
I just want to assure you Baudelaires that you have absolutely nothing...
translation.ko: 너희 보들레어 남매에게 장담컨대 그 무엇도...

translation.en: We have absolutely nothing.
[sighs] ...to worry about.
I am the executor of your parents' estate,
which means I'll be handling all matters concerning everything they left behind.
translation.ko: 두 분이 남기신 모든 유산에 관한 문제는 내가 처리한다는 뜻이란다

translation.en: What did they leave behind?
Financial security.
[Mr. Poe] Your parents left behind an enormous fortune,
which will be yours when Violet comes of age.
translation.ko: 바이올렛이 성인이 되면 너희 몫이 될 거다

translation.en: Until then, you will be placed with the proper guardian, or guardians,
translation.ko: 그때까지 너희를 맡길 적절한 후견인 혹은 후견인들은

translation.en: as decided by myself and my fellow bankers at Mulctuary Money Management.
translation.ko: 멀크튜어리 자산 관리 회사의 동료들과 내가 결정할 거다

translation.en: Say goodbye, Baudelaires.
Goodbye.
[Mr. Poe] Until we've identified your designated guardian,
you'll stay with my family.
That's not so bad, is it, Baudelaires?
I'm sure you'll become fast friends with Edgar and Albert.
-[Edgar] It's a raven. -[Albert] It's a crow!
-It's a raven! -It's a crow!
It's chicken. Boiled chicken.
And we have boiled potatoes and blanched string beans.
What does "blanched" mean?
-It means "boiled." -Nobody asked you.
Now, now, son.
No, my darling, Albert is right. Nobody asked the Baudelaires.
translation.ko: 아니야, 여보 앨버트 말이 맞아 누가 보들레어 애들을 데려오랬나?

translation.en: But, honey, look!
Dearest, maybe not in front of the children.
translation.ko: 여보 "산산조각 난 보들레어 저택" 애들 앞에서는 좀...

translation.en: But I thought it would cheer them up, the little Gloomy Guses.
translation.ko: 저 음울한 꼬마들이 기뻐할 줄 알았는데

translation.en: I had my star reporter write an article for the front page
so that everyone will know
your home was destroyed and you're orphans now.
translation.ko: 너희 집은 파괴됐고 이제 너희는 고아라고!

translation.en: The front page!
Some people wait a lifetime for that.
And darling, look... you're mentioned, too!
translation.ko: 그리고 여보, 이것 봐 당신 이름도 있어!

translation.en: "Generosity shown by prominent member of the banking community."
If your bosses at the bank see this, it may spell
translation.ko: 자기 은행 상사가 보면 이렇게 되겠지

translation.en: P-R-O-M-A-T-I-O-N!
-Promation? -Promotion!
-No, that's not how you spell "promotion." -[Eleanora] Promotion.
-See? I've been saying it-- -Honey, P-R-R...
Listen to what I'm saying... -I'm sorry. -...before you start speaking!
-[Eleanora] P-R-O-- -I don't... feel very hungry.
May we go to our rooms?
[coughs] "Rooms"?
-Good night, Edgar. -Good night, Albert.
translation.ko: - 잘 자라, 에드거 - 잘 자라, 앨버트

translation.en: -Good night, Albert. -Good night, Edgar.
translation.ko: - 잘 자라, 앨버트 - 잘 자라, 에드거

translation.en: And good night, guests.
You must feel terrible, and you must miss your parents very much.
translation.ko: 기분이 더럽고 부모님이 겁나게 보고 싶겠지

translation.en: We do.
You do what?
Say it.
We feel terrible, and we miss our parents very much.
translation.ko: 기분이 더럽고 부모님이 겁나게 보고 싶어요

translation.en: [sighs deeply] That's gonna make a wonderful headline.
Good night, Baudelaires. Remember, our home is your home.
translation.ko: 잘 자라, 보들레어 남매들아 너희 집이라고 생각하렴

translation.en: But don't touch anything.
How'd you do it?
Do what?
Set the fire.
[Lemony] In the years since, I've inquired what became of the Brothers Poe.
translation.ko: 저는 이후 포 형제의 행적을 조사하고 다녔습니다

translation.en: One followed his father into the world of banking.
translation.ko: 한 명은 아버지의 뒤를 이어 은행업계에 입성했고

translation.en: The other lives in a cave and talks to sheep.
translation.ko: 다른 하나는 동굴에 살며 양과 대화하죠

translation.en: They each think the other has it better.
I regret to inform you, the Baudelaires' fate was worse.
translation.ko: 유감스러운 말씀입니다만 보들레어 남매의 운명은 훨씬 더 불행했습니다

translation.en: Chop-chop, Baudelaires!
Now that I've found you a suitable guardian,
I'm going to take you to your new home before banking hours begin.
I know you must be nervous about living with a guardian.
I remember how I was when I was your age.
We're all different ages.
Well, I should think at least a fraction of your unhappiness
translation.ko: 그래도 이분을 만나면 코딱지만큼의 불행이라도 기쁨으로 변할 거야

translation.en: will turn to excitement when you meet this man.
I know he's certainly very eager to meet you.
translation.ko: 그분도 너희를 간절히 만나고 싶어 하시는데

translation.en: And he's employed as an actor, so you know his excitement is genuine.
translation.ko: 그분의 직업은 배우이니 진심이신 걸 알겠지?

translation.en: His name is Count Olaf.
-Never heard of him. -He's either... Let's see. What is it?
Your third cousin fourth time removed, or your fourth cousin three times removed.
In any case, he's removed.
Still, he's only three miles away, and your parents' will was very specific
translation.ko: 그래도 겨우 5km 거리에 사시는데 부모님의 구체적인 유언장에 따르면

translation.en: about your being raised by your closest living relative.
translation.ko: 너희를 가장 가까운 친척에게 맡기라고 하셨다

translation.en: Does he really think that's what "closest living relative" means?
-Mr. Poe? -Hmm?
If he lives so close by,
why didn't our parents ever invite him over?
Possibly because he was very busy.
As a banker, I'm often very busy myself.
Which is why this guardian drop-off is going to be a bit hasty.
translation.ko: 그래서 너희를 후견인에게 성급히 데려다줘야 해

translation.en: "Hasty" means "quickly," because I'm due at the bank soon.
translation.ko: 출근 시간에 맞춰 서둘러야 한다는 뜻이란다

translation.en: We know what "hasty" means.
Hello there! Salutations! Shalom!
You must be the Baudelaire children!
Yes, I'm Violet Baudelaire,
and this is my brother, Klaus, and this is my sister, Sunny.
And this is Mr. Poe. He's been arranging things for us.
Mulctuary Money Management. My name and title are on the card.
translation.ko: 멀크튜어리 자산 관리 회사 소속입니다 제 이름과 직함은 명함에 있는데

translation.en: Although I may be in line for a promotion, so that might change.
translation.ko: 곧 승진 예정이라 직함은 바뀔 수도 있답니다

translation.en: Oh, well, I am Justice Strauss of the High Court.
Forgive my not shaking hands, but as you can see, I am a mountain of parcels.
translation.ko: 악수 못 해서 미안한데 보다시피 짐이 산더미라서

translation.en: I just bought a new toolkit because my food processor broke.
translation.ko: 믹서가 고장 나서 새 연장 세트를 샀는데

translation.en: Although I don't know who I think I'm kidding,
because I have no inventive or mechanical skill whatsoever.
Then I treated myself to new file cards for my private library,
translation.ko: 그리고 내 개인 도서관에 쓰려고 카드 정리함을 샀는데

translation.en: and frankly I don't have an acute literary sense.
translation.ko: 난 솔직히 문학적 감성이 발달하지 않았거든

translation.en: And then, to top it all off, I forgot to buy a new bread knife.
translation.ko: 게다가 화룡점정으로 새 빵 칼 사는 걸 깜빡했단다

translation.en: It means I have no possible way of cutting up this baguette into bite-sized pieces,
translation.ko: 그래서 이 바게트를 먹기 좋게 자를 수 없는데

translation.en: which is really unfortunate
because I was gonna take the bread that was cut up
with a white bean hummus--
We'd be more than happy to be of assistance, Justice Strauss.
My sister is very mechanically minded, and I'm quite adept at library science.
translation.ko: 누나는 기계에 굉장히 밝고 저는... 도서관학에 꽤 능하거든요

translation.en: What my sister means is her teeth are perfect for slicing bread.
translation.ko: 제 동생이 자기 이로 빵을 자를 수 있대요

translation.en: [gasps] Well, how wonderful!
How lucky am I to have such unusual children in my life?
translation.ko: 이리도 보기 드문 아이들이 생기다니 운도 좋지!

translation.en: Are you Count Olaf's wife?
What?
Oh! Oh, no!
No. No. Goodness me, no.
No, I don't even really know him that well.
He's... he's just my neighbor.
His house is over there.
That's strange.
He said specifically he was waiting very eagerly to get his hands on you.
translation.ko: 분명히 얼른 너희를 손에 넣고 싶다고 하셨는데

translation.en: Hello. No.
[creepily] Hello.
[Olaf] Hello, hello, hello.
Hello. Hello.
Hello, hello, hello, children.
I am Count Olaf, the renowned actor and your new guardian.
translation.ko: 나는 올라프 백작이다 유명 배우 겸 너희의 새 후견인이지

translation.en: You're welcome.
Thank you.
You're welcome.
Please, come in, and mind you wipe your feet on the mat
translation.ko: 얼른 들어와라 흙 안 떨어지게 발은 깔개에 닦고

translation.en: so you don't track in any mud.
translation.ko: 흙 안 떨어지게 발은 깔개에 닦고

translation.en: And don't forget your enormous fortune!
Welcome to my humble home, orphans.
translation.ko: 소박한 내 집에 온 걸 환영한다, 고아들아

translation.en: And...
-a man with a hat on. -Poe.
Actually, I'm about to be rather wealthy. So if you'll excuse me--
translation.ko: 제가 곧 갑부가 될 예정이라서요 - 이만... - 저랑 통화하셨잖아요

translation.en: No, we spoke on the phone. I'm from Mulctuary Money Management.
translation.ko: - 이만... - 저랑 통화하셨잖아요 멀크튜어리 자산 관리 회사 소속입니다

translation.en: Hmm. "Money" sounds familiar, but--
The bank. I'm from the bank.
Ah, yes, the bank.
Well, welcome to my humble home.
translation.ko: 소박한 내 집에 온 걸 환영합니다

translation.en: [coughing] It does seem to need a little work.
Well, I realize it's not as fancy as the Baudelaire mansion,
but perhaps, children, with a bit of your money,
translation.ko: 하지만 얘들아 너희 돈을 좀 써서

translation.en: we'll be able to fix it up, make it nicer.
translation.ko: 더 멋지게 단장할 수 있을 거다

translation.en: Count Olaf, the Baudelaire fortune is not to be used for such matters.
translation.ko: 제가 다 막을 겁니다 그런 데 쓸 재산이 아니에요

translation.en: The Baudelaire will is very specific as to how the children are to be raised
translation.ko: 보들레어 유언장에는 이런 불운한 사건에 대비해

translation.en: in case of an unfortunate event.
Ah, yes, the fire.
They're to be raised by their closest relative.
translation.ko: 아이들은 가장 가까운 친척이 길러야 해요

translation.en: That is I, Count Olaf.
And every cent of the Baudelaire fortune is locked up until Violet comes of age.
translation.ko: 그리고 모든 유산은 바이올렛이 성인이 될 때까지 동결됩니다

translation.en: -Which one is Violet? -[Mr. Poe] The eldest.
All right, then. [inhales deeply]
Well, I hope I can prove myself to be the father you never had.
translation.ko: 내가 너희 평생에 없었던 아버지가 되고 싶구나

translation.en: We had a father.
Yes, I know. And a mother.
Remarkable woman. Flammable.
So, Poe, do I need to sign for them or something?
What? No. No.
Well, then, as we say in the theater, exit stage right.
Goodbye, Violet. Goodbye, Klaus. Goodbye, Sunny.
I hope you'll be happy here. I'll still check in on you occasionally.
translation.ko: 여기서 행복하길 바란다 그래도 종종 확인하러 오마

translation.en: If you need anything or have questions, you can reach me at the bank.
Well, children, before I give you a tour of your new home,
aren't you going to say "How do you do?"
to your new guardian?
How do you do?
How do I do?
Better and better, Baudelaires.
Better and better.
The dreadful villainy of this vile fiend
has haunted me since I first met him as a young man.
translation.ko: 젊은 시절 이자를 만난 이래 쭉 저를 괴롭혔습니다

translation.en: And every night when I continue my work on the Baudelaire case,
translation.ko: 저는 매일 밤 보들레어 사건을 조사할 때마다

translation.en: I find myself weeping thinking of his utter wickedness
translation.ko: 그의 극심한 사악함과 심각하게 부족한 연기력을 떠올리며

translation.en: and severe lack of theatrical talent.
-Do you know what this is? -It looks like a list.
Wrong! It's a list. A list of chores.
Rich brats like you are probably spoiled rotten and have never done a chore in your life.
translation.ko: 너희 부잣집 애새끼들은 허드렛일을 해 본 적 없겠지

translation.en: Actually, we often help around the house.
[mockingly] Really? Did you help around the house? That's great.
[normal] Well, welcome to your lucky life.
translation.ko: 이제 재수 좋은 인생이 펼쳐질 거다

translation.en: Come with me, and I'll show you the delightful features of your home.
translation.ko: 따라와라 너희 집의 멋진 특색을 소개해 주마

translation.en: This is the kitchen, where you may help yourselves to meals.
translation.ko: 여기는 너희가 직접 밥을 차려 먹을 주방이다

translation.en: I expect you to keep everything gleamingly clean.
"Gleamingly"?
-Clean. -[fly buzzing]
The stove is a bit like a servant.
-You have to whack it sometimes... -[knuckles cracking] ...to get it to work.
translation.ko: 말을 듣게 하려면 가끔 후려쳐야 하지

translation.en: This is the library, which you will keep well-dusted.
translation.ko: 이곳은 도서관이다 계속 먼지만 쌓아 두도록

translation.en: This is where I do all my reading.
I don't use the ballroom at all.
You'll have to redo the floors.
Laundry room. You can hang my underwear on that rack when you're done washing it.
translation.ko: 세탁실, 내 속옷을 빨면 저 선반에 걸면 된다

translation.en: This is the backyard, which needs weeding, mowing and pruning.
translation.ko: 여기는 뒤뜰이다 잡초를 뽑고, 깎고 가지를 쳐라

translation.en: It is also where you will chop wood.
Bathroom number seven, the only one you are allowed to use.
translation.ko: 7번 화장실 너희는 여기만 쓸 수 있다

translation.en: It has all the usual amenities,
though the management regrets to inform you
that the shampoo is not tear-free.
If anything, it encourages tears.
Rats bite.
And this is where you will sleep, orphans.
translation.ko: 그리고 여기는 너희 고아들이 잘 곳이다

translation.en: Out of all the numerous bedrooms in this enormous mansion,
translation.ko: 이 거대한 저택의 수많은 침실 중에

translation.en: I have chose this one for your safety and comfort.
translation.ko: 너희의 안전과 쾌적함을 위해 이 방을 골랐다

translation.en: There's only one bed.
As you can see, I have provided, at no cost to you,
translation.ko: 보다시피 나는 너희에게 돈도 안 받고

translation.en: this complimentary pile of rocks.
Thoughts?
Thoughts? First of all--
First of all, first impressions are often wrong.
Very true.
For example, your first impression of me may be that I am a terrible person.
translation.ko: 예를 들어 나에 대한 첫인상은 끔찍한 인간 같을 텐데

translation.en: But in time, Baudelaires, I hope you'll come to realize...
translation.ko: 하지만 조만간 너희 보들레어 자식들이... 깨닫길 바란다

translation.en: you haven't the faintest idea.
translation.ko: 너희는 감히 감도 못 잡았다는 걸

translation.en: I'll give you a moment to unpack.
It's okay, Sunny, he's gone.
He's horrible.
Did you see the tattoo on his ankle?
A tattoo is just a decorative pigment on skin.
It's not a sign of a wicked person.
-Unless it's on a wicked person. -[sighs]
How could our parents put us here?
translation.ko: 왜 부모님은 우리를 이런 데로 보내셨지?

translation.en: [sighs] It's just a mistake. It'll get sorted out.
Until then, we'll make this our home.
Mother used to say, "Home is where you hang your hat."
translation.ko: 어머니께선 누울 곳만 있으면 집이라고 하셨는데

translation.en: But we don't have any hats.
Just rocks.
Klaus, have you read any books on people who make homes in difficult places?
translation.ko: 클라우스 어려운 환경에 정착한 사람들에 관한 책 읽어 봤니?

translation.en: There's a village in the Pacific Islands
suspended on ropes above an active volcano.
How do they manage?
They own very little in case it erupts.
translation.ko: 화산이 폭발할까 봐 거의 빈손으로 산대

translation.en: Then we're already one step ahead.
-We own nothing. -[chuckles lightly]
If they can survive that, we can survive Count Olaf.
translation.ko: 그렇게 사는 사람도 있다면 우린 올라프 백작을 견딜 수 있어

translation.en: Showtime!
Remember, if you work extra hard, you get to go to the ball... room...
translation.ko: 명심해라, 더 열심히 일하면 연회장에 갈 수 있다

translation.en: which is even grimier.
Hang on to your toothbrushes.
You'll need them for your teeth.
-[doorbell chiming] -Stay here. And not a peep.
You're a little old for a Girl Scout.
I'm Justice Strauss.
Doesn't ring a bell.
I'm your neighbor. I... I live across the street.
You've done something different to your hair.
May I come in?
Is this about the children?
I apologize for the noise. I told them to cry using their inside voices.
translation.ko: 소음은 미안합니다 속으로 조용히 울라고 했는데

translation.en: -What? -Hmm?
I... I just thought I'd stop by and see how they're doing.
translation.ko: 그냥 애들이 잘 지내나 잠깐 들렀어요

translation.en: I know it's a little soon, but I'm about to become very busy
translation.ko: 아직 좀 이르긴 하지만 곧 까다로운 사건 때문에 엄청 바빠질 예정이거든요

translation.en: with a difficult case in High Court.
translation.ko: 곧 까다로운 사건 때문에 엄청 바빠질 예정이거든요

translation.en: I'm not supposed to talk about it,
but I can tell you that it involved an illegal use of someone's credit card...
translation.ko: 이 사건은 누군가의 신용 카드 불법 도용과

translation.en: and a poisonous plant.
I made them this lamb.
How neighborly.
I don't mean to seem like a lonely woman
who's overinvested in the lives of someone else's children...
You do have that aura.
Perhaps if I just pop in for a quick hello--
Now is not a good time. They're in one of their moods. [shudders]
translation.ko: 지금은 곤란합니다 애들이 또 심통을 부려서요

translation.en: They seemed so sweet.
Do you have children, Justice Strauss?
Me?
Oh, no. No.
No, I always hoped I would, but I'm married to the law,
translation.ko: 늘 자식을 바랐지만 저는 법과 결혼했고

translation.en: and you can't very well have book babies...
now, can you?
Well, you dodged a bullet.
Let me tell you, those children are monsters.
I open my home to them, and all they do is complain.
translation.ko: 내 집에 받아 줬거늘 입만 열면 불평이에요

translation.en: "The bathroom is filthy.
The rat is noisy. The bed is cramped."
I think living in a mansion has spoiled them.
translation.ko: 저택에 살면서 버릇이 잘못 들었나 봅니다

translation.en: Well, they did just lose their--
Did you say "bed"?
I meant "bed" as in "more than one bed," obviously.
translation.ko: 당연히 침대 여러 개를 뭉뚱그려 말한 겁니다

translation.en: The plural of "bed" is... "bed."
Well, I wouldn't know. I live alone.
No kidding.
At least give them the lamb.
I made my own mint jelly and...
Please, just ask them if they'd like to see me.
translation.ko: 제발 부탁해요 제가 보고 싶은지 물어봐 주세요

translation.en: [sighs] Fine.
But wait here, for your own safety. They tend to throw things.
translation.ko: 하지만 위험하니 여기서 기다리시죠 뭘 자꾸 던져서요

translation.en: You missed a spot.
They don't want to see you.
Are you sure? What did they say?
"The lamb was too salty."
Rich kids.
Oh... I see.
[Lemony] If only Justice Strauss had been able to get past Count Olaf,
translation.ko: 슈트라우스 판사가 올라프 백작을 그냥 지나쳐서

translation.en: if only she'd seen the children in their horrible circumstances,
if only this world weren't such a wicked and topsy-turvy place...
translation.ko: 이 세상이 이리도 사악하고 혼란스럽지 않았더라면

translation.en: this story might have turned out differently.
translation.ko: 이 이야기는 전혀 다르게 흘러갔을지도 모르죠

translation.en: -I never wanna use a toothbrush again. -[door opens]
Why aren't you cleaning? My list was very specific.
translation.ko: 왜 청소 안 해? 아주 상세한 목록을 줬잖아

translation.en: We finished it.
No, you didn't.
We even washed your underwear.
You missed one.
You still have to prepare a large meal for myself and my theater troupe.
translation.ko: 나와 극단 동료들을 위한 진수성찬을 차려야지!

translation.en: We don't know how to prepare a large dinner.
Plan the menu, purchase the ingredients,
prepare the food, set the table, serve dinner, clean up afterward,
translation.ko: 요리하고, 상 차리고 음식 나르고, 끝나면 치우고

translation.en: and stay out of our way.
How can we purchase anything? We don't have any money.
Do you know what that is?
-Something greasy. -Money.
Hard-earned money.
The most important substance on earth besides applause and lip balm.
translation.ko: 박수갈채와 립밤 빼고 지구 상 가장 중요한 물질이지

translation.en: Since the bossy banker won't let us use any of your parents' enormous fortune,
translation.ko: 거들먹거리는 은행가가 막대한 유산을 못 쓰게 하니

translation.en: I am now forced to cough up my own earnings
translation.ko: 이제 나는 어쩔 수 없이 연극 공연과

translation.en: from theatrical performances and the occasional bit of consulting work.
translation.ko: 종종 상담으로 번 내 수입을 토해내야 해

translation.en: Now... quick. Get a move on.
The troupe will be here at 7:00.
And in the meantime, I will be up in...
Can you guess?
Your secret tower room?
Wrong! My secret tower room.
Which you are forbidden to go into. Understood? Forbidden!
translation.ko: 너희는 출입 금지야 알아들어? 출입 금지!

translation.en: -Forbidden. -That's... Yes.
How are we supposed to make dinner for an entire theater troupe?
translation.ko: 극단 전체를 위한 식사를 어떻게 준비하지?

translation.en: We start with a recipe.
Do you think Justice Strauss' library has any cookbooks?
[gasps] Baudelaires. I wasn't expecting to see you.
We meant to come sooner. We've been cleaning.
translation.ko: 더 일찍 찾아뵙고 싶었는데 청소하느라 바빠서요

translation.en: Yes, Count Olaf told me you were very particular about that.
translation.ko: 그래, 올라프 백작께 너희가 참 깔끔하다고 들었다

translation.en: I hope you appreciate how much he's doing for you.
translation.ko: 많은 걸 베푸시는 백작님께 감사하길 바란다

translation.en: I wouldn't say "much."
Well, perhaps not compared to what you're used to.
What can I do for you?
Actually, Justice Strauss, we really need your help.
You do?
My sisters and I were wondering...
Wondering what?
If we might use your library.
If you might use my library.
Is there any book you're looking for in particular?
A cookbook, so we can make dinner.
I suppose anything but lamb.
Well, my private library is open to you whenever you'd like.
translation.ko: 내 개인 도서관은 원한다면 언제든 이용하렴

translation.en: It's mostly law books, but there are sections on everything
translation.ko: 대부분 법률 서적이지만 온갖 책들이 있단다

translation.en: from Italian cuisine to the world's most threatening fungus.
translation.ko: 대부분 법률 서적이지만 온갖 책들이 있단다 이탈리아 요리부터 가장 위협적인 곰팡이까지

translation.en: I suppose it's not as nice as the libraries you're used to, but...
translation.ko: 예전 너희 집 도서관만큼 좋지는 않겠지만...

translation.en: -It's marvelous. -It's wonderful.
Do you really think so?
-[squeaks] -That means she likes it.
Well, I'm so glad.
The cookbooks are over there in Section G,
and right here is my favorite table for serious research.
translation.ko: 난 심각한 연구를 할 때면 저 테이블에 앉는단다

translation.en: Do you have a paper and pencil to take notes?
Always.
-[Strauss] What's that? -It’s something my parents had.
-What is it? -I don't know.
Something, Klaus Baudelaire, is ringing a very faint bell.
A library is like an island in a vast sea of ignorance.
translation.ko: 도서관이란 광활한 무지의 바다에 떠 있는 섬과 같단다

translation.en: Don't you agree?
I do. Particularly if the library is tall and the surrounded area has been flooded.
translation.ko: - 그렇지 않니? - 맞아요 특히 도서관 천장이 높고 주변 지역에 홍수가 났다면요

translation.en: That's a very good point.
These books look promising.
Klaus, help your sister. Let me see what I can find here.
translation.ko: 클라우스, 누나를 도와주렴 나도 책을 찾아보마

translation.en: I think I found something. Pasta puttanesca.
translation.ko: 이게 괜찮을 것 같아 파스타 푸타네스카 어때?

translation.en: I wonder what that means in Italian.
All we have to do is sauté garlics and onions in a pot,
and then add olives, capers, anchovies, diced parsley and tomatoes to simmer.
translation.ko: 거기에 올리브와 케이퍼, 안초비 다진 파슬리와 토마토를 넣고 끓이면 돼

translation.en: We still need the pasta.
I saw a pasta machine in Count Olaf's kitchen.
translation.ko: 올라프 백작님 주방에서 파스타 기계를 봤어

translation.en: -Looked broken, but I think I can fix it. -What do we have here?
translation.ko: 고장 난 것 같던데 내가 고칠 수 있을 거야

translation.en: Justice Strauss?
-Yes? -Is there a supermarket nearby?
Oh... no.
But there is a local open-air market and gin distillery.
translation.ko: 근데 동네에 야외 시장과 진 양조장은 있단다

translation.en: Thanks again for taking us.
translation.ko: 데려가 주셔서 다시 한 번 감사해요

translation.en: I don't know what we would have done without you.
Oh, you're resourceful children. I daresay you would have thought of something.
translation.ko: 너희는 재치 있는 아이들이니 뭔가 방책을 생각해 냈겠지

translation.en: I think it's nice that you're cooking dinner
translation.ko: 올라프 백작과 새 극단 가족을 위해

translation.en: for Count Olaf and your new theatrical family.
translation.ko: 올라프 백작과 새 극단 가족을 위해 저녁을 준비하다니 대견하구나

translation.en: I had dreams of becoming an actress, you know.
An actress and a mother, instead of ending up
translation.ko: 배우이자 어머니를 꿈꿨는데 결국 세계적으로 유명한 사법부의 일원이 되어

translation.en: as a world-renowned member of the judiciary...
translation.ko: 결국 세계적으로 유명한 사법부의 일원이 되어

translation.en: and in a series of strained, platonic relationships.
translation.ko: 껄끄럽고 정신적인 연애만 하게 될 줄이야

translation.en: Baudelaires?
I always find cooking for family to be something of a mitzvah.
translation.ko: 난 가족을 위한 요리를 일종의 '미츠바'라고 생각해

translation.en: Do you know what that means?
-Commandment? -Blessing.
You children have had such sorrow in your lives already,
translation.ko: 너희는 어린 나이에 벌써 큰 슬픔을 겪었으니

translation.en: you deserve the blessing of a new family with Count Olaf,
translation.ko: 올라프 백작과 새 가정을 꾸리는 축복을 누릴 자격이 있고

translation.en: and, if you don't mind my saying so...
with me.
[chuckles] We don't mind your saying so.
Klaus, what's that thing James Brown said?
"I feel good."
-[accordion playing] -And a one, and a two, and a...
♪ It's the count, it's the count It's the count ♪
♪ It's the count, it's the count It's the count ♪
♪ Who else has such robust good looks In such a large amount? ♪
♪ I'm handsome and I'm talented And love your bank account ♪
translation.ko: 난 잘생겼고 재능 있고 너희 계좌를 사랑해

translation.en: ♪ It's the count, it's the count It's the count ♪
♪ It's the count, it's the count It's the count ♪
♪ The "C" is for courageous Just another word for brave ♪
-[troupe] ♪ O! ♪ -♪ Oh, my God ♪
♪ What a very handsome knave ♪
-[troupe] ♪ U! ♪ -♪ Unbelievable good looks ♪ ♪ And brains and heart ♪
-♪ N! ♪ -♪ For the knowledge ♪
♪ 'Cause I'm very, very smart ♪
-♪ T! ♪ -♪ For the talent ♪
♪ Which is such a crucial factor ♪
♪ When you're handsome and good-looking ♪ ♪ And the world's greatest actor ♪
translation.ko: 잘생긴 데다 매력적이기까지 한 세계 최고의 배우라면!

translation.en: [troupe] ♪ It's the count, it's the count It's the count ♪
♪ It's the count, it's the count It's the count ♪
♪ Who else has such robust good looks In such a large amount? ♪
♪ I'm handsome and I'm talented And love your bank account ♪
translation.ko: 난 잘생겼고 재능 있고 너희 계좌를 사랑해

translation.en: ♪ It's the count, it's the count It's the count ♪
♪ It's the count, it's the count ♪
♪ It's the count ♪
♪ The count ♪
Yes, we've met.
Orphans... [clears throat] ...this is my theater troupe.
-Hi. -Hi.
-Hi. -[white-faced women] Hello.
And as anyone in the theater knows, after a grand entrance,
translation.ko: 연극계에서는 누구나 알다시피 화려한 등장 후에

translation.en: the audience is supposed to applaud.
"Applaud" means go like this.
We're not an audience.
No, orphans, you are not.
But we have been preparing an exciting new production
translation.ko: 하지만 우리는 흥미진진한 신작을 준비 중이고

translation.en: that, on opening night, will change your life.
translation.ko: 개막 공연 때 너희 삶이 바뀔 것이다

translation.en: All of the artistic and financial aspects of my career are finally coming together
translation.ko: 내 배우 경력의 예술성과 금전적인 측면이 마침내 하나가 되겠지

translation.en: like two pieces of a bread in the middle of a sandwich.
translation.ko: 마치 샌드위치 사이에 든 빵 두 조각처럼

translation.en: What my sister means is that--
I don't care what she means.
I don't have time to learn a second language
besides whatever it is I'm speaking right now.
translation.ko: 또 다른 언어를 배울 시간은 없어

translation.en: In any case, we demand congratulations.
[both] Congratulations.
A big round of applause.
And the delicious meal that you promised myself and my troupe.
translation.ko: 그리고 나와 극단에 대접하기로 한 진수성찬도

translation.en: You know, every time she talks,
it's like the tines of a fork are being jammed into my--
What my sister means is, dinner will be served shortly.
What are we supposed to do until then?
-We could wait patiently. -How about some wine, Olaf?
translation.ko: - 얌전히 기다리지 뭐 - 포도주 어때, 올라프?

translation.en: Yes, yes, wine. We had that nice rosé last time.
translation.ko: 그래, 포도주! 저번에 마신 로제 좋더라

translation.en: It wasn't rosé, it was just watered down.
translation.ko: 로제가 아니라 포도주에 물 탄 거였어

translation.en: [sighs] Okay, fine. I'll open up a box of the Merlote.
translation.ko: 그래, 알았어 메를로 포도주 한 상자 열게

translation.en: An associate of mine named Brillat-Savarin famously said,
translation.ko: 브리야사바랭이라는 제 동료는 이런 명언을 남겼죠

translation.en: "To invite people to dine with us is to make ourselves responsible
translation.ko: '누군가를 식사에 초대하는 건' '손님이 집에 머무는 동안'

translation.en: for their well-being as long as they are under our roofs."
translation.ko: '손님이 집에 머무는 동안' '그의 건강을 책임진다는 뜻이다'

translation.en: But he was an 18th century philosopher and gourmand...
and these were three children with very little catering experience.
translation.ko: 이 세 아이는 접대 경험이 거의 없었죠

translation.en: Nevertheless, the Baudelaire orphans snapped into action.
translation.ko: 그럼에도 불구하고 보들레어 고아들은 행동에 착수했습니다

translation.en: This pasta maker reminds me of the one built by Thomas Jefferson.
translation.ko: 토머스 제퍼슨이 만든 파스타 기계 같네

translation.en: Will it work?
-It will now. -[chuckles]
I wonder if Count Olaf's troupe will enjoy this meal.
Mother said that actors will eat anything.
You've seen them perform. Would you call them actors?
translation.ko: 공연하는 거 봤잖아 그래도 배우로 인정해?

translation.en: -They're all as talented as Count Olaf. -[scoffs]
[Lemony] While they waited for the pasta to boil,
Violet sautéed the garlic, and washed and chopped the anchovies.
translation.ko: 바이올렛은 마늘을 살짝 볶고 안초비를 씻고 잘랐습니다

translation.en: Klaus peeled the tomatoes and pitted the olives.
translation.ko: 클라우스는 토마토를 까고 올리브 씨를 뺐으며

translation.en: And Sunny banged on a pot with a wooden spoon,
singing a rather repetitive song she had written herself.
By the time it was time for the youngest Baudelaire
to chop the parsley with her teeth...
all three children felt less miserable than they had...
translation.ko: 세 아이 모두 올라프 백작의 집에 온 뒤

translation.en: since they first came to Count Olaf's.
I think Dad would be proud of this sauce.
And I think Mom would be proud of how you made your own pasta.
translation.ko: 엄마는 누나가 만든 파스타를 뿌듯해 하셨겠지

translation.en: Maybe we can make this our home after all.
Remember what Father said when he burnt the quesadillas?
translation.ko: 아버지가 케사디야를 태우고 하셨던 말씀 기억해?

translation.en: Yeah.
"Better than nothing."
At times like these, surrounded by colleagues and cohorts,
gathered in fellowship for the purpose of plotting theater,
translation.ko: 연극을 계획할 목적으로 하나로 뭉쳤을 때

translation.en: there's an eternal question that always springs to mind...
[yelling] When are we going to eat?
Dinner is served.
-Wow, that was quick. -And it smells delicious.
-[Olaf groans] -I mean... [grunts]
As I was saying, before the help interrupted...
there is no "I" in acting...
no selfish urges, no arrogance,
no ego, no vanity,
no dangerous overabundance of inflated self-regard.
There is only what the French call a certain... "escargot."
It is the first burst of applause when the curtain rises.
translation.ko: 바로 커튼이 올라가며 터져 나오는 첫 박수 세례

translation.en: -[grunts] -The second burst of applause
translation.ko: 이어 두 번째 박수가 나오는 순간은

translation.en: when the leading man glides out from the wings,
translation.ko: 이어 두 번째 박수가 나오는 순간은 주연 배우가 측면에서 슬그머니 나오면서

translation.en: faces his crowd and recites the--
-Soliloquy. -[sighs]
I'm... That's... His soliloquy.
It is the thrill of the 14th mandatory standing ovation.
I give and I give to my public
translation.ko: 이 몸은 나의 팬들에게 무한히 베풀리라

translation.en: just as I give and I give to these orphans.
But sometimes, and every actor does this,
I ask myself, "Is it worth it?
Is it really worth it to chase an enormous fortune?"
[clearing throat] Boss...
-Where's the roast beef? -What?
The roast beef.
We didn't make any roast beef. We made puttanesca sauce.
translation.ko: 소고기구이는 안 만들었어요 푸타네스카 소스만 만들었죠

translation.en: And homemade pasta.
What? No roast beef?
You didn't tell us you wanted roast beef.
Look at my guests!
They... they can hardly touch this revolting foreign food.
translation.ko: 이 역한 외국 음식에 손도 못 대잖아!

translation.en: [scoffs] In agreeing to adopt you, I became your father.
translation.ko: 너희를 입양하기로 하면서 난 아버지가 됐다

translation.en: And as your father, I am not someone to be trifled with.
translation.ko: 그리고 너희 아버지인 나는 너희에게 놀아날 사람이 아니야!

translation.en: You can't go easy on children. They need to be taught to obey their elders.
translation.ko: 애들은 봐주지 말고 어른 말을 듣게 가르쳐야지

translation.en: You asked them to make dinner.
And all they did was slap together some disgusting sauce.
That's what happens with wealthy kids. Money is really a corrupting influence.
translation.ko: 부잣집 애들은 다 그래 돈이 사람을 더럽히거든

translation.en: Well, let's not get carried away.
Hmm. You're a pretty little one.
I demand that you serve roast beef to myself and my guests!
translation.ko: 이 몸과 내 손님들에게 소고기구이를 대접해라!

translation.en: We don't have any. We made pasta puttanesca.
translation.ko: 없어요, 파스타 푸타네스카를 만들었다고요 "후식은 초콜릿 푸딩이다"

translation.en: -[Violet] Sunny! -Put her down.
[chuckles deviously] Alas, poor Sunny.
-Let her go! -[all gasp]
This table is a mess. There's hardly a place to put down a baby.
translation.ko: 식탁이 엉망이군 애를 내려놓을 자리도 없어

translation.en: [Violet] Sunny!
We're leaving for rehearsals.
But the baby said there was chocolate pudding!
You children are to clean the table,
and wash the dishes, and polish the silver,
and rinse out all the wine bottles for recycling.
And then you are to go straight to your beds.
You mean our bed?
You've only provided us with one bed.
If you want another bed,
tomorrow you may go into town and purchase one.
translation.ko: 내일 시내에 가서 하나 사 오도록 해라

translation.en: You know perfectly well we haven't any money.
Hmm. Of course you do.
You three lucky orphans are inheriting an enormous fortune.
translation.ko: 너희 운 좋은 세 고아는 막대한 재산을 물려받게 됐으니까!

translation.en: The money our parents left behind is not to be used until Violet--
translation.ko: 부모님이 남기신 돈은 누나가 성인이 될 때...

translation.en: The theater awaits.
-Are you all right? -No. [whimpers]
-This isn't. -What?
Better than nothing.
[Lemony] There are many, many things that are better than nothing.
translation.ko: 없는 것보다 나은 건 많고도 많습니다

translation.en: A home-cooked meal is better than nothing.
translation.ko: 집에서 만든 음식은 없는 것보다 낫죠

translation.en: A roof over one's head is better than nothing.
translation.ko: 머리 위의 지붕은 없는 것보다 낫습니다

translation.en: And a place to sleep,
even if the bed is very small and the blanket damp with tears,
translation.ko: 설령 침대가 아주 작고 눈물 젖은 담요가 축축해도

translation.en: is better than nothing.
But being raised in a violent and sinister environment
translation.ko: 다만 타인의 안락과 행복보다 재산에 더 눈독 들이며

translation.en: by a man more interested in one's fortune than comfort and well-being
translation.ko: 폭력적이고 해로운 환경에서 아이들을 키우는 남자는

translation.en: is not better than nothing.
And as the Baudelaires would discover,
there are some things that even a long night of introspection
cannot change.
[Lemony] The Baudelaire orphans knew they had to find a way
translation.ko: 보들레어 고아들은 끔찍할 만큼 불행한 환경에서 벗어날 방법을 찾아야 했고

translation.en: out of their dreadfully unfortunate circumstances,
translation.ko: 끔찍할 만큼 불행한 환경에서 벗어날 방법을 찾아야 했고

translation.en: and, perhaps, solve the mystery of how they ended up in them.
translation.ko: 그런 처지에 놓이게 된 수수께끼를 풀어야 했죠 "불완전한 비밀의 역사"

translation.en: I have the same dedication to researching and presenting this story
translation.ko: 저 역시 이 이야기를 연구하고 알리기 위해

translation.en: no matter what dangers it puts me in.
Trouble and strife can cover this world like the dark of night,
translation.ko: 문제와 갈등은 이 세상을 칠흑 같은 어둠이나

translation.en: or like smoke from a suspicious fire.
translation.ko: 미심쩍은 화재의 연기로 뒤덮을 수 있습니다

translation.en: And when that happens...
...all good, true and decent people know that it's time to volunteer.
translation.ko: 착하고 진실한 사람들은 발 벗고 나서죠

translation.en: -I'm worried about the children. -Me, too.
They're in danger, I know it.
We need to get to them.
We need to get out of here first.
[sighs] What's that thing Einstein said?
